alert.note: Alert for Eastern Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 01 at 10:21AM EDT until May 02 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SNOW AND FREEZING TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF EASTERN TUCKER COUNTY... .Snow is expected overnight Monday into Tuesday. Wet snow combined with gusty winds and will put stress on trees that have already developed leaves. Power outages may result. Snow accumulations will be tied to the nighttime hours, and largely elevation dependent. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Temperatures as low as 30 degrees possible. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 10 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause power outages. Sub-freezing temperatures may pose threats to sensitive vegetation and exposed outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
